info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 11:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow will affect Putnam and Bureau counties through 100 AM CST... At 1059 PM CST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from near Ohio to Wenona. Movement was north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Visibilities of one mile to a quarter of a mile. SOURCE...Radar and Observations IMPACTS...Snow covered surfaces including roadways, bridges, overpasses, and sidewalks. Accumulations of one to two inches are expected through daybreak. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Hennepin, Spring Valley, Henry, DePue, Granville, Walnut, Ladd, Wyanet, Tiskilwa, La Moille, Dalzell, Bureau Junction, McNabb, Putnam, Mark, Ohio, Cherry, Malden, and Seatonville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 49 and 72. Interstate 180 between mile markers 1 and 13. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
